creator: fhanik@apache.org
text: For now the goal was to still be able to compile the core with 1.5, until that changes,we can defer this issue

creator: chris@christopherschultz.net
text: The @override annotation was introduced in 1.5, so this shouldn't be a problem. Did you mean 1.4?

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
Note that jdbc does not currently compile with Java 1.5, because several files use @Override annotations for implementations of interface methods.
Such overrides require Java 1.6.

Both Java 1.5 and Java 1.6 support @Override annotations for "true" method overrides.

So I don't see why the proposed patch cannot be applied, as it will work with both Java 1.5 and 1.6.

creator: fhanik@apache.org
sebb@apache.org

text:
Comment on attachment 26045
Add missing annotations

Parially applied
creator: sebb@apache.org

text: Part of the original patch was omitted; there are two other methods that are missing the @Override annotations.
creator: sebb@apache.org

text: Override annotations will be applied as we do code cleanup. They are not a bug at the moment
creator: fhanik@apache.org
